com.tplmaps3d.sdk.location

Class FusedLocationHelper

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.tplmaps3d.sdk.location.FusedLocationHelper
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    com.google.android.gms.common.api.GoogleApiClient.ConnectionCallbacks, com.google.android.gms.common.api.GoogleApiClient.OnConnectionFailedListener, com.google.android.gms.common.api.ResultCallback<com.google.android.gms.location.LocationSettingsResult>, com.google.android.gms.location.LocationListener 

    public class FusedLocationHelper
extends java.lang.Object
implements com.google.android.gms.common.api.GoogleApiClient.ConnectionCallbacks, com.google.android.gms.common.api.GoogleApiClient.OnConnectionFailedListener, com.google.android.gms.location.LocationListener, com.google.android.gms.common.api.ResultCallback<com.google.android.gms.location.LocationSettingsResult>
    Utility class to provide some help while implementing Google's FusedLocationAPI
    Since:
    Jan, 2017

      • onRequestPermissionsResult

        public void onRequestPermissionsResult(int requestCode,
                                       @NonNull
                                       java.lang.String[] permissions,
                                       @NonNull
                                       int[] grantResults)
        Callback for the result from requesting permissions. This method is invoked for every call on Activity.requestPermissions(String[], int).

        Note: It is possible that the permissions request interaction with the user is interrupted. In this case you will receive empty permissions and results arrays which should be treated as a cancellation.

        For more description: ActivityCompat.OnRequestPermissionsResultCallback.onRequestPermissionsResult(int, String[], int[])}

        See Also:
        Activity.requestPermissions(String[], int)

      • onResult

        public void onResult(@NonNull
                     com.google.android.gms.location.LocationSettingsResult locationSettingsResult)
        The callback invoked when SettingsApi.checkLocationSettings(GoogleApiClient, LocationSettingsRequest) is called. Examines the LocationSettingsResult object and determines if location settings are adequate. If they are not, begins the process of presenting a location settings dialog to the user.
        Specified by:
        onResult in interface com.google.android.gms.common.api.ResultCallback<com.google.android.gms.location.LocationSettingsResult>

      • setLocationUpdatesEnabled

        public void setLocationUpdatesEnabled(boolean enable)
        Set Location Updates on/off (true/false) for continuous updates.

        NOTE: Method will work only with MapController.setMyLocationEnabled(boolean)'s call.

        Parameters:
        enable - boolean true/false

      • getLocationUpdatesEnabled

        public boolean getLocationUpdatesEnabled()

      • getLastLocation

        public android.location.Location getLastLocation()
                                          throws java.lang.SecurityException
        Get last location by checking Permission and Location Settings related configuration. Also if TPLLocationListener's listener is registered then user will have TPLLocationListener.onLastLocationRequest(Location) callback whenever this method invoked
        Returns:
        Location
        Throws:
        java.lang.SecurityException
